'''''Tolkien Studies'': Volume 8''', published in [[2011]], is the eighth volume of the annual review ''[[Tolkien Studies (journal)|Tolkien Studies]]''.
{{Tolkienstudiesnav|7|9}}

==Contents==
* Articles
** Philip Irving Mitchell, "'Legend and History Have Met and Fused': The Interlocution of Anthropology, Historiography, and Incarnation in J.R.R. Tolkien's '[[On Fairy-stories]]'"
** John M. Bowers, "Tolkien's Goldberry and ''The Maid of the Moor''"
** Lucas Annear, "Language in Tolkien's '[[Bagme Bloma]]'"
** [[José Manuel Ferrández Bru]], "'Wingless fluttering': Some Personal Connections in Tolkien's Formative Years"

* Notes and Documents
** [[John Garth]], "Robert Quilter Gilson, T.C.B.S.: A Brief Life in Letters"
** [[Janet Brennan Croft]], "The Hen that Laid the Eggs: Tolkien and the Officers Training Corps"

* Book Reviews
** ''Quenya Phonology: Comparative Tables, Outline of Phonetic Development, Outline of Phonology'' (''[[Parma Eldalamberon 19]]''), by J.R.R. Tolkien, edited by [[Christopher Gilson]], reviewed by John Garth
** ''[[Hither Shore (journal)|Hither Shore]]: Interdisciplinary Journal of Modern Fantasy Literature, Jahrbuch der Deutschen Tolkien Gesellschaft e.V.'', edited by Thomas Fornet-Ponse (editor-in-chief), [[Marcel Bülles]], [[Thomas Honegger]], Rainer Nagel, Alexandra Velten, and Frank Weinreich, and ''Volume four, 2007 (2008): "Tolkiens Kleinere Werke" [Tolkien's Lesser Works]'', and ''Volume five, 2008 (2009): "Der Hobbit" [The Hobbit]'', reviewed by Mark T. Hooker
** ''[[Music in Middle-earth]]'', edited by Heidi Steimel and Friedhelm Schneidewind, reviewed by Gerald Seaman
** ''[[Middle-earth Minstrel]]: Essays on Music in Tolkien'', edited by Bradford Lee Eden, reviewed by Gerald Seaman
** ''The Power of Tolkien's Prose: Middle-Earth's Magical Style'', by Steve Walker, Reviewed by Richard C. West
** ''The Saga of King Heidrek the Wise'', edited by [[Christopher Tolkien]], reviewed by [[Tom Shippey]]
** Book Notes, by [[Douglas A. Anderson]]

* Review-Essay
** ''[[The Ring Goes Ever On: Proceedings of the Tolkien 2005 Conference|The Ring Goes Ever On]]'', edited by Sarah Wells, reviewed by Deidre A. Dawson

* [[David Bratman]] and Merlin DeTardo, "The Year's Work in Tolkien Studies 2008"
* Rebecca Epstein, David Bratman, [[Michael D.C. Drout]], Merlin DeTardo, and Douglas A. Anderson, "Bibliography (in English) for 2009"

==External links==
* [https://muse.jhu.edu/issue/23163 ''Tolkien Studies'': Volume 8] at Project Muse
* Review: Troels Forchhammer, "The year in perspective", ''[[Mallorn]]'', [[Mallorn 53|vol. 53]] (Spring [[2012]])
